data.text:
U.S. retail sales are up in June! 🎉 Key points: - Core retail sales surged 0.9% in June. - Online sales and spending on dining, furniture, and electronics all increased. - Economic outlook remains positive, with the Atlanta Fed upgrading Q2 GDP growth estimates to 2.5%. Despite headwinds like slowing wage growth and increased credit card debt, consumer spending continues to drive the economy forward. The Fed's next move on interest rates will depend on upcoming inflation data. #RetailSales #Economy #ConsumerSpending #EconomicGrowth Photo Credit: Reuters

Are loyalty programs the key driver of consumer engagement? In today's challenging economic climate, consumers are increasingly seeking value through deals and promotions. This trend is driving heightened engagement with loyalty programs across various sectors. Recent earnings calls highlight the impact: - Under Armour's UA Rewards program, launched less than a year ago, already boasts nearly 5 million members, with 50% being new customers - Sally Beauty's loyalty program generated 78% of U.S. and Canadian sales in Q3, with 16 million members - E.L.F. BEAUTY saw a 30% year-over-year growth in loyalty program enrollment, reaching over 5 million members - Krispy Kreme's loyalty program relaunch contributed to a 27% membership growth and a 22% increase in digital sales - Noodles & Company reported that loyalty members account for 26% of sales and spend twice as much as non-members - Vivid Seats is seeing higher repeat orders, driven by its industry-leading loyalty program As the gap between high-income and low-income consumers widens, loyalty programs offer brands a powerful tool to foster customer retention, boost sales, and gather valuable first-party data. #LoyaltyPrograms #CustomerEngagement #Retail #Earnings #ConsumerBehavior

Carrefour Belgium uses #AI on a large scale to reduce food waste! 🔍 Smart Discounts in Action Every day, Carrefour discounts over 40,000 items simply because they are approaching their expiration dates—a task that can consume countless man-hours. Their new AI tool will change that by streamlining operations, reducing costs, and boosting profitability 🛒 A Game Changer for Retail This innovative tool gives them full control over shelf stock and integrates intelligent discounting, making it a vital part of their strategy to reduce waste and enhance economic performance. With real-time inventory monitoring and demand prediction, they can minimize the risks of over- or understocking. Plus, by simplifying daily workflows, their employees can save up to an hour of work each day per store! #Innovation #AI #RetailTech #Sustainability #SmartRetail #FoodWasteReduction Photo by Ella Olsson on Unsplash

July brought a modest rise in retail spending as consumers geared up for the school season! 🏫 Retailers like Walmart and Target stepped up with major sales events in response to Amazon's Prime Day, fueling the growth. In fact, total retail sales (including restaurants but excluding automobiles and gasoline) were up 0.74% month-over-month and 0.92% year-over-year. 📈 Key Sector Highlights: - Online & Non-Store Sales: +0.82% MoM, +18.45% YoY - General Merchandise Stores: +1.75% MoM, +9.68% YoY - Electronics & Appliances: +0.57% MoM, +5.27% YoY - Furniture & Home Furnishings: +1.41% MoM, +2.29% YoY While consumers remain cautious, the back-to-school season shows that spending continues when value is found. NRF President and CEO Matthew Shay notes, "Labor market trends have softened recently, and interest rates remain high, but economic fundamentals are intact, and inflation has fallen to nearly zero for goods." #Retail #ConsumerSpending #EconomicTrends #RetailSales

Who are the most valuable Retail Brands in 2024? 1. Amazon 🇺🇸 $308.9B (+3%) 2. Walmart 🇺🇸 $96.8B (-15%) 3. The Home Depot 🇺🇸 $52.8B (-14%) 4. Costco Wholesale 🇺🇸 $48.4B (+4%) 5. CVS Health 🇺🇸 $30.2B (-1%) 6. Target 🇺🇸 $26.4B (-5%) 7. Lowe's Companies, Inc. 🇺🇸 $25.0B (-21%) 8. Taobao Marketplace 🇨🇳 $20.2B (-34%) 9. Tmall 🇨🇳 $18.6B (-32%) 10. JD.COM 🇨🇳 $17.8B (-6%) 🔝 Amazon Leads the Pack Once Again For the ninth consecutive year, Amazon reigns as the most valuable retail brand globally, boasting an impressive brand valuation of $308.9 billion—a 3% increase from last year. Despite its dominance in e-commerce, Amazon still trails behind Walmart in total global revenues, with Walmart bringing in a staggering $628.6 billion. 📊 U.S. Brands Dominate The U.S. continues to lead in brand value, with seven out of the top ten most valuable retail brands hailing from the U.S. Together, U.S. brands account for 66% of total global brand value, a testament to their strong market presence and consumer loyalty. 💡 The Bigger Picture Despite their impressive valuations, many top brands faced declines in 2024, with China's Taobao experiencing the most significant drop of 34%. As the retail landscape evolves, the competition remains fierce, especially with emerging e-commerce platforms making waves. #Retail #Ecommerce #BusinessInsights #Retailer #RetaiIindustry #OnlineShopping

I’m very excited about deepening one of our closest partnerships with Tradebyte! As an ex-employee of Zalando its a personal satisfaction to partner with a Zalando company. But its not only the personal level that works well here. We are also focusing on very close API integration to increase on-boarding speed and really deliver the best optimization experience to our joined customers. Our collaboration centralizes pricing strategies into one easy-to-use hub, making international omni-channel operations more efficient. A great example is Tamaris (Wortmann Schuh-Holding), who saw a 5% reduction in discount rates and significant time savings thanks to our solution. I’m really proud of what we’re achieving together! #PriceOptimisation #RetailInnovation #MachineLearning #OmniChannel #Ecommerce #RetailTech

Microsoft's Electricity Use Doubled in Four Years 🌍 🔍 Key Highlights from Microsoft's 2024 Sustainability Report: - Electricity Consumption: Increased from 11 TWh (FY20) to 24 TWh (FY23). - Carbon Emissions: Climbed 42%, from 12 million metric tons in FY20 to 17 million metric tons in FY23. - Data Centers: Construction alone contributed to 30% of the emissions rise between 2020-2023. - AI Impact: Massive investment in supercomputers for AI, especially for training models like OpenAI’s GPT-4, which consumed up to 62,000 MWh—enough to power 1,000 U.S. households for 5-6 years. I believe it will become more and more important for #ai solutions to show that they do AI with less resource usage. This will save money and Co2 emissions. #AI #Sustainability #Microsoft #Energy #TechInnovation #ClimateChange #GreenTech #emissions

Today is the last day of 7Learnings' first employee Mojca Bertoncelj! It makes me very sad to see you leave, but I'm also immensely grateful for your contribution. Today, it's very rare to have loyal employees that stay with a startup for more than 5 years. You have contributed more than 5,000 commits to our repository and pushed us a lot closer to our vision of becoming the globally leading retail AI. Thank you so much for your contribution and all the best for your next steps. #retail #ai #machinelearning #optimizations #retailinnovation #ecommerce #retailer #retailindustry #onlineshopping #shoponline #marketing #DynamicPricing

Who has the Largest Courier Companies in the World? The continued rise of e-commerce has spurred tremendous growth in the courier industry. As more consumers shop online, courier companies have had to expand their capabilities to meet soaring delivery volumes. A breakdown of the largest courier companies by market capitalization (as of Feb 9, 2024) reveals some clear leaders: 1. United Parcel Service (UPS)🇺🇸 - $126B 2. FedEx 🇺🇸 - $60.4B 3. DHL Group (Deutsche Post) 🇩🇪 - $54.5B 4. Japan Post Holdings Co., Ltd. 🇯🇵 - $30.5B 5. S.F. EXPRESS CO. LTD 🇨🇳 - $25.6B Other notable companies include ZTO Express, Poste Italiane, and TFI International Inc. Despite challenges like global supply chain disruptions, natural disasters, and geopolitical tensions, these companies continue to innovate. FedEx, for example, is experimenting with AI-powered sorting robots to boost efficiency. The future of courier services looks promising as these companies strive to enhance speed and availability worldwide. #Ecommerce #CourierIndustry #Logistics #SupplyChain #Innovation #BusinessGrowth #retailindustry #onlineshopping
